pronunciation: S'ARDONYX, [Latin sardonyches, from Gr. from Sardis, a city of Asia Minor, and a nail; so named, according to Pliny, from the resemblance of its color to the flesh under the nail.]A

definitions.text: silicious stone gem, nearly allied carnelian. Its reddish yellow, nearly orange. We are informed that yellow orange colored agate, with undulating surface, now often called sardonyx
